body.p: Identify the respiratory structures that air passes through during inspiration.

fill_in_the_blank.choice: Kidney- This is where the nephrons produce urine.
Ureters- Urine travels from the kidneys by circular contraction and transported to the bladder through these.
Urinary bladder- Here is where urine is temporarily contained by internal and external sphincter muscles.
Urethra- Here is where the entire process ends when urine exits out of the body through this.
Renal artery- The urinary process begins with blood carrying various wastes entering each of the two kidneys through this.
Kidney- This is where the nephrons produce urine.
Ureters- Urine travels from the kidneys by circular contraction and transported to the bladder through these.
Urinary bladder- Here is where urine is temporarily contained by internal and external sphincter muscles.
Urethra- Here is where the entire process ends when urine exits out of the body through this.
Renal artery- The urinary process begins with blood carrying various wastes entering each of the two kidneys through this.
Kidney- This is where the nephrons produce urine.
Ureters- Urine travels from the kidneys by circular contraction and transported to the bladder through these.
Urinary bladder- Here is where urine is temporarily contained by internal and external sphincter muscles.
Urethra- Here is where the entire process ends when urine exits out of the body through this.
Renal artery- The urinary process begins with blood carrying various wastes entering each of the two kidneys through this.
Kidney- This is where the nephrons produce urine.
Ureters- Urine travels from the kidneys by circular contraction and transported to the bladder through these.
Urinary bladder- Here is where urine is temporarily contained by internal and external sphincter muscles.
Urethra- Here is where the entire process ends when urine exits out of the body through this.
Renal artery- The urinary process begins with blood carrying various wastes entering each of the two kidneys through this.
Kidney- This is where the nephrons produce urine.
Ureters- Urine travels from the kidneys by circular contraction and transported to the bladder through these.
Urinary bladder- Here is where urine is temporarily contained by internal and external sphincter muscles.
Urethra- Here is where the entire process ends when urine exits out of the body through this.
Renal artery- The urinary process begins with blood carrying various wastes entering each of the two kidneys through this.

response.feedback: Correct. The kidneys are where the nephrons produce urine.
Incorrect. The kidneys are where the nephrons produce urine. Where does it travel once it is produced?
Incorrect. The kidneys are where the nephrons produce urine. Where is it stored once it is produced?
Incorrect. The kidneys are where the nephrons produce urine. It is not where it ends.
Incorrect. This is where urine is produced.
Incorrect. The ureters is how urine moves from the kidneys.
Correct. Urine travels from the kidneys by circular contraction and transported to the bladder through the ureters.
Incorrect. This is how urine travels but where is it temporarily stored? Urinary bladder
Incorrect. Although this is how urine travels, it is not where urine travels out of the body.
Incorrect. The ureters is how urine moves from the kidneys.
Incorrect. This is where urine is held.
Incorrect. This is where urine is held. How does it get to the bladder?
Correct. The urinary bladder is where urine is temporarily contained by internal and external sphincter muscles.
Incorrect. The bladder functions to keep food and water out of the larynx and must be located just anterior to it.
Incorrect. This is where urine is held.
Incorrect. Where the correct answer are where urine is produced, the urethra is where it concludes.
Incorrect. Where the correct answer is how urine travels, the urethra is where it concludes.
Incorrect. Where the correct answer is where urine is temporarily stored during the urinary process, the urethra is where the urinary process ends.
Correct. The urethras are where the entire urinary process ends when urine exits out of the body.
Incorrect. Where the renal artery is where the urinary process begins, the urethra is where it concludes.
Incorrect. Blood travels through the renal artery and carries various wastes as it enters each of the two kidneys.
Incorrect. Blood travels through the renal artery. Where does urine travel through?
Incorrect. This is the beginning of the urinary process. Where is urine stored during the process?
Incorrect. This is the beginning of the urinary process. Where does it end? Kidneys
Correct. The urinary process begins with blood carrying various wastes entering each of the two kidneys through the renal artery.
